intro: Stachys pycnantha, commonly known as woolly betony, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Stachys pycnantha is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
